messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a world with twelve rooms. From the lobby you have two choices, room 1 and room 2. You enter room 1, at the end there's a door that leads to room 3, and room 3 leads to room 5. There is a door in room 5 that leads to room 7 and room 7 leads to room 9. From room 9 you can enter room 11. There's a chest in room 11. You open it and there is 10 dollars, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time in the lobby you choose room 2, then enter room 4, which leads to room 6. There is a door in room 6 that leads to room 8 and room 8 leads to room 10. At the end there is a door that leads to room 12. There's a chest with 50 dollars in room 12, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money.  Starting from the lobby, which path will lead to the most money?  Please list all room numbers in order, separated by commas

.

And the answer is C, which goes through rooms 1,3,5,7,9,11,12. Each room is a number. You will get a lot of similar questions. I have explained the regex, the user can understand. Then the program goes back to its original state.

By default, Google Assistant does not support sending SMS. However, you can change it by setting the default SMS app to Messages. To do this, you need to go to Settings -> Apps -> Messages -> Permissions -> Default App. Then, select Messages and save the changes.

Now, when you say "Hey Google, send a text to (person)", Google Assistant will use Messages instead of the default SMS app.

The AI-powered Google Assistant is one of the best ways to communicate with your phone. It is a powerful tool that can help you do many things, such as sending text messages, making calls, playing music, and more. Here are some tips on how to use Google Assistant to send text messages.

In this tutorial, I will show you how to send a text message using Google Assistant. I will use the Google Assistant app for this tutorial.

Step 1: Open the Google Assistant

You are told that room 1 now opens to another room, room 14. Room 14's door leads to all neighboring rooms of room 10. Remember that you will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money.  Starting from the lobby, which path will lead to the most money?  Please list all room numbers in order, separated by commas.

The answer is C, which goes through rooms 1,3,5,7,9,11,14,10,12,13,15. Each room is a number. You will get a lot of similar questions. I have explained the regex, the user can understand. Then the program goes back to its original state.

You can also send a text message using Google Assistant on your phone. To do this, you need to open the Google Assistant app and say "send a text message to (person)". You can also say "send a text message to (person) using Messages".

Google Assistant can also send a text message to multiple people. To do this, you need to say "send a text message to (person) and (person)". You can also say "send a text message to (person) and (person) using Messages".

Google Assistant can also send a text message to a group. To do this, you need to say "send a text message to (group)". You can also say "send a text message to (group) using Messages".

Google Assistant can also send a text message to a business. To do this, you need to say "send a text message to (
